headline: Amazon Labour Ruling Tests Cost Assumptions In Fulfilment Network Narrative
summary: The B.C. Labour Relations Board has ruled that Amazon imposed an unlawful wage freeze on about 800 unionized workers at its Delta, B.C. fulfillment center. The dispute centers on wage adjustments during ongoing contract talks, with negotiations reportedly stalled since December 2025. The union has applied for mediation in an effort to speed up a first collective agreement and resolve the wage issue. For investors watching Amazon.com, NasdaqGS:AMZN, this ruling comes as the share price sits...

headline: Berkshire Hathaway Takes Stake In New York Times, Cuts Apple, Amazon Holdings
summary: Berkshire Hathaway late Tuesday disclosed a new position in the New York Times valued at about $350 million.  Warren Buffett's Berkshire reduced positions in Apple, BofA and Amazon.  Late Tuesday, New York Times shares rose 3% to a new high as Berkshire's stake became public.

headline: Cadence beats quarterly profit and revenue estimates on strong AI-linked demand
summary: Cadence Design Systems beat quarterly revenue estimates on Tuesday, as strong demand for complex ‌artificial intelligence processors lifted sales of its chip design ‌software. Shares of the San Jose, California-based company were up nearly 4% in ​extended trading. Elevated demand for chips that can handle complex AI processes has benefited the company, which offers specialized design software for mapping out intricate circuits and blueprints for common components ‌such as memory connectors.

Shares of the San Jose, California-based company were up nearly 4% in ​extended trading. Elevated demand for chips that can handle complex AI processes has benefited the company, which offers specialized design software for mapping out intricate circuits and blueprints for common components ‌such as memory connectors.

headline: Berkshire Buys New York Times Stock; Sells Apple, Bank of America, Amazon In 4Q
summary: Berkshire Hathaway  continued to trim its stake in  Bank of America  and  Apple  in the fourth quarter and it initiated a new holding in  New York Times  buying five million shares of the newspaper publishing company, according to a 13-F filing after the close of trading Tuesday.  Berkshire also sold most of its holdings in  Amazon  com in the period.  Berkshire reduced its stake in Bank of America by 51 million shares, or about 9%, to 517 million shares, while trimming its interest in Apple by 4%, or 10 million shares, to 227 million.

raw.headline: Berkshire Buys New York Times Stock; Sells Apple, Bank of America, Amazon In 4Q
raw.summary: Berkshire Hathaway  continued to trim its stake in  Bank of America  and  Apple  in the fourth quarter and it initiated a new holding in  New York Times  buying five million shares of the newspaper publishing company, according to a 13-F filing after the close of trading Tuesday.  Berkshire also sold most of its holdings in  Amazon  com in the period.  Berkshire reduced its stake in Bank of America by 51 million shares, or about 9%, to 517 million shares, while trimming its interest in Apple by 4%, or 10 million shares, to 227 million.

headline: Berkshire Cuts Amazon Stake, Makes Bets on New York Times

headline: Outdoor camera, surveillance maker Tactacam explores sale, sources say
summary: The private equity owner of Tactacam is exploring a sale that ‌could value the maker of cameras and surveillance technology ‌for hunters and outdoor enthusiasts at more than $1.5 billion, according to ​people familiar with the matter.  Bertram Capital, which acquired Tactacam in 2023, is working with investment bank JPMorgan on the sale process, which is at an early stage, the sources ‌said.  Bertram and Tactacam did not respond to requests for comment.

ServiceNow Inc. has committed to opening an office in West Palm Beach.

headline: Amazon vs. Walmart: Which is capturing the US consumer better?
summary: Walmart (WMT) is riding strong momentum in 2026, surging 20% year-to-date and hitting a $1 trillion market cap. E-commerce giant Amazon (AMZN), on the other hand, is down 14% year-to-date amid mass layoffs. Northwestern Mutual Wealth Management Company CIO Brent Schutte joins Yahoo Finance executive editor Brian Sozzi and Yahoo Finance senior business reporters Ines Ferré and Brooke DiPalma to break down the battle for US consumers, from groceries to third-party delivery and advertising, and weigh which stock may offer more value in today's market. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: Adage Capital trims stakes in AI heavyweights
summary: Adage Capital Partners said in its latest filing with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission ‌that it trimmed its investments in some AI heavyweights in ‌the fourth quarter of 2025, while Softbank Group Corp reported it had dissolved its stake ​in Nvidia, a transaction the company first disclosed in November.  Adage disclosed small cuts to stakes in Microsoft , Alphabet and Amazon, as well as Nvidia.  The ⁠Boston-based investment firm did not immediately respond to a request for comment about the changes in its portfolio.

headline: Tech Weekly: OpenAI unhappy with DeepSeek, Amazon Leo lifts off
summary: STORY: From OpenAI's DeepSeek frustrations to Amazon's satellite lift-off, this is Tech Weekly.:: Tech WeeklyOpenAI warned U.S. lawmakers about the actions of Chinese AI startup DeepSeek.A memo seen by Reuters showed the Sam Altman-led firm believes DeepSeek has tried to replicate U.S. models and use them for their own training.The technique is known as distillation, where older AI models evaluate the quality of answers coming from a newer model - which effectively transfers the older version's learnings.DeepSeek and its parent company High-Flyer didn't respond to Reuters' requests for comment.Russia has completely blocked WhatsApp.The Kremlin accused the Meta-owned messenger app of not complying with local law.Moscow suggested Russians should instead turn to a state-backed 'national messenger' called MAX.But critics argue MAX is a surveillance tool, while Russian authorities deny this.Britain could ban children under-16 from social media as early as this year.It could also close a loophole which left some AI chatbots outside safety rules.It's part of government efforts to respond faster to digital risks.Spain, Greece and Slovenia have also said they're working on bans after Australia became the first country in the world to block under 16s from social media.Europe launched its new Ariane 64 heavy-lift rocket.It carried 32 Amazon Leo satellites with it and sent them into low earth orbit.it marked the debut of the most powerful version of the Ariane 6 launcher developed by Airbus and Safran joint venture Arianespace.Amazon Leo is a low Earth orbit satellite network designed to provide internet service to customers beyond the reach of existing terrestrial networks - and could rival SpaceX's Starlink.And Samsung said it's started to ship its most advanced HBM4 chips to unamed customers.It's trying to catch up to rivals supplying critical parts for Nvidia AI accelerators.The global rush to build AI data centers has fueled demand for such chips.The semiconductors feed massive amounts of data to the accelerators for training and running AI models.

raw.headline: Tech Weekly: OpenAI unhappy with DeepSeek, Amazon Leo lifts off
raw.summary: STORY: From OpenAI's DeepSeek frustrations to Amazon's satellite lift-off, this is Tech Weekly.:: Tech WeeklyOpenAI warned U.S. lawmakers about the actions of Chinese AI startup DeepSeek.A memo seen by Reuters showed the Sam Altman-led firm believes DeepSeek has tried to replicate U.S. models and use them for their own training.The technique is known as distillation, where older AI models evaluate the quality of answers coming from a newer model - which effectively transfers the older version's learnings.DeepSeek and its parent company High-Flyer didn't respond to Reuters' requests for comment.Russia has completely blocked WhatsApp.The Kremlin accused the Meta-owned messenger app of not complying with local law.Moscow suggested Russians should instead turn to a state-backed 'national messenger' called MAX.But critics argue MAX is a surveillance tool, while Russian authorities deny this.Britain could ban children under-16 from social media as early as this year.It could also close a loophole which left some AI chatbots outside safety rules.It's part of government efforts to respond faster to digital risks.Spain, Greece and Slovenia have also said they're working on bans after Australia became the first country in the world to block under 16s from social media.Europe launched its new Ariane 64 heavy-lift rocket.It carried 32 Amazon Leo satellites with it and sent them into low earth orbit.it marked the debut of the most powerful version of the Ariane 6 launcher developed by Airbus and Safran joint venture Arianespace.Amazon Leo is a low Earth orbit satellite network designed to provide internet service to customers beyond the reach of existing terrestrial networks - and could rival SpaceX's Starlink.And Samsung said it's started to ship its most advanced HBM4 chips to unamed customers.It's trying to catch up to rivals supplying critical parts for Nvidia AI accelerators.The global rush to build AI data centers has fueled demand for such chips.The semiconductors feed massive amounts of data to the accelerators for training and running AI models.

headline: India's Adani to invest $100 billion in AI-ready data centres by 2035
summary: Adani Enterprises said on Tuesday that the group will invest $100 billion to build renewable ‌energy-powered AI-ready data centres by 2035, as it seeks ‌to create the world's largest integrated data centre platform and establish India ​as a leader in the global AI race.  The investment is expected to spur an additional $150 billion in spending over the next decade across several related industries including sovereign cloud platforms ‌and server manufacturing, the ⁠company said.  Adani's investment will create a $250 billion AI infrastructure ecosystem in India over the decade, ⁠it added.

headline: Modi Seizes AI Summit to Assert India’s Global Ambitions After Tough Year
summary: Two months into the new year, he’s secured major trade pacts with the European Union and the US, will host several foreign leaders in the coming weeks who want to clinch their own deals, is riding a wave of popular support following key state elections, and his top officials expect economic growth will beat the government’s own forecasts.  This week, Modi will have an opportunity to showcase not only India’s global ambitions but also his own resurgence when he takes the stage at a high profile artificial intelligence summit in New Delhi.  In attendance at the India AI Impact Summit will be more than a dozen heads of state, including from France and Brazil, and some of the most influential leaders in the tech world — from OpenAI’s Sam Altman to Sundar Pichai of Alphabet Inc. to Anthropic PBC’s Dario Amodei.

raw.headline: Modi Seizes AI Summit to Assert India’s Global Ambitions After Tough Year
raw.summary: Two months into the new year, he’s secured major trade pacts with the European Union and the US, will host several foreign leaders in the coming weeks who want to clinch their own deals, is riding a wave of popular support following key state elections, and his top officials expect economic growth will beat the government’s own forecasts.  This week, Modi will have an opportunity to showcase not only India’s global ambitions but also his own resurgence when he takes the stage at a high profile artificial intelligence summit in New Delhi.  In attendance at the India AI Impact Summit will be more than a dozen heads of state, including from France and Brazil, and some of the most influential leaders in the tech world — from OpenAI’s Sam Altman to Sundar Pichai of Alphabet Inc. to Anthropic PBC’s Dario Amodei.
